definition: according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: An estimated four thousand types of forams live in the world’s oceans.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，在海洋中生活着4000种有孔虫。

sentences.english: An estimated fifth of them are in the country illegally.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这些拉美裔人口中约五分之一都是非法移民。

sentences.english: Smoking is estimated to kill more than one million Chinese a year.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，中国每年有超过一百万的人死于吸烟。

sentences.english: An estimated 23,000 dolphins and porpoises are killed in Japan each year.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，日本每年有2万3千只海豚和小鲸被屠杀。

sentences.english: By some estimates, more than a million flamingos flock to Bogoria.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，有一百多万只火鹤飞到博高瑞亚。

sentences.english: Malnutrition is estimated to contribute to more than one third of all child deaths.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，营养不良造成所有儿童死亡的三分之一以上。

sentences.english: It has been estimated that the United States now has nearly 800,000 gang members.
sentences.chinese: 据估计现今美国以有约八十万个帮派成员。

sentences.english: By some estimates, it generates billions of dollars each year.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这类活动牟取的暴利每年可达几十亿美元。

sentences.english: It is estimated that 2 percent to 14 percent of the U.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，百分之二至十四的美国人是代谢功能不全者。

sentences.english: It is estimated that over half a billion people in China know how to play Chinese chess.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，在中国有超过五亿人懂得下象棋。

sentences.english: Estimates suggest the cost to the poultry industry has been in excess of US$10 billion.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，家禽饲养业的损失已超过100忆美元。

sentences.english: There are an estimated 100 billion neurones that make up the brain's communication network.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，构成大脑的沟通网络的神经元有一千亿。

sentences.english: They estimate that each of the 3264 top sites is targeted by around 280 typo domains.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这些网站平均每个有大约280个误植域名。

sentences.english: According to some estimates the ratio of bad loans in the banking system could shoot up almost to 10 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，银行系统的坏账率将飙升至10%。

sentences.english: It's estimated that the claw hook of the cargo crane can't heave the heavy lumber up.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，该货物起重机爪形钩吊不起那些沉重的木材。

sentences.english: Total costs for the plan are estimated in the hundreds of billions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这项计划的全部耗资将达到数千亿美元。

definition: according to belief/it is believed that
it is said/allegedly/according to reports/or so they say
according to a report/It is reported that...
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
up to/no less than/as much as
